revisions.rev:
{{Infobox software | name = Scribus | logo = [[File:Scribus logo.svg|60px]] | screenshot = [[File:Scribus-1.3-Linux.png|250px]] | caption = Scribus under [[Linux Mint]] | collapsible = | developer = The Scribus Team | released = {{Start date|2003|June|26}} | discontinued = | latest release version = 1.3.3.14 | latest release date = {{Start date and age|2010|01|28}} | latest preview version = 1.4.0 RC6 | latest preview date = {{Start date and age|2011|10|19}} | frequently updated = | programming language = [[C++]] using [[Qt (toolkit)|Qt]] | operating system = [[Cross-platform]] | platform = | size = | language = [[Multilingual]] | status = Active | genre = [[Desktop publishing]] | license = [[GNU General Public License|GPL]] | website = [http://www.scribus.net www.scribus.net] }} '''Scribus''' is a [[desktop publishing]] (DTP) application, released under the [[GNU General Public License]] as [[free software]]. It is based on the free [[Qt (toolkit)|Qt]] toolkit, therefore native versions are available for [[Linux]], [[Unix]]-like operating systems, [[Mac OS X]], [[Microsoft Windows]], and [[OS/2]]. It is known for its broad set of page layout features, comparable to leading non-free applications such as [[Adobe PageMaker]], [[PagePlus]], [[QuarkXPress]] or [[Adobe InDesign]]. Scribus is designed for flexible layout and [[typesetting]] and the ability to prepare files for professional quality [[image]] setting equipment. It can also create [[animated]] and [[interactive]] [[Portable Document Format|PDF]] presentations and forms. Example uses include writing small [[newspaper]]s, [[brochure]]s, [[newsletter]]s, [[poster]]s and [[book]]s. An official Scribus [[User guide|manual]], published through FLES Books,{{cite web |url=http://www.flesbooks.com/scribus1.3manual/ |archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20100106230447/http://www.flesbooks.com/scribus1.3manual/ |title=Scribus 1.3 Official Manual|year=2009|accessdate=September 30, 2011|archivedate=January 6, 2010|publisher=FLES Books}} has been available since January 19, 2009.{{cite web|url=http://flesbooks.com/|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20100117031927/http://www.flesbooks.com/|title=Welcome to FLES Books|year=2009|accessdate=September 30, 2011|archivedate=January 17, 2010|publisher=FLES Books}} ==Capabilities== Scribus supports most major [[image format]]s including [[Scalable Vector Graphics|scalable vector graphics]] (SVG). Professional type/image setting features include [[CMYK color model|CMYK]] colors and [[International Color Consortium|ICC]] [[color management]]. It has a built-in [[Scripting language|scripting engine]] using [[Python (programming language)|Python]]. It is available in more than 24 languages. Printing is achieved using its own internal level 3 [[PostScript]] driver, including support for [[font]] embedding and sub-setting with [[TrueType]], [[Type 1 font#Font handling|Type 1]] and [[OpenType]] fonts. The internal driver supports full Level 2 PostScript constructs and a large subset of Level 3 constructs. [[Portable Document Format|PDF]] support includes transparency, encryption and a large set of the PDF 1.4 spec as well as [[PDF/X]]-3{{cite web |url=http://docs.scribus.net/index.php?lang=en&page=pdfx3 |title=Scribus PDF/X-3 Overview |accessdate=2011-05-22}}, including interactive PDFs form fields, annotations and bookmarks. The file format, called SLA, is based on [[XML]]. Text can be imported from [[OpenDocument]] text documents, as well as [[SXW|OpenOffice.org Writer]], [[Microsoft Word]] and [[HTML]] formats (although some limitations apply). Scribus cannot read or write the native file formats of commercial programs like [[QuarkXPress]], [[Microsoft Publisher]], or [[InDesign]]; the developers feel that [[reverse engineering]] those file formats would be prohibitively complex and could risk legal action from the makers of those programs.[http://docs.scribus.net/index.php?lang=en&page=faq1#15 Scribus FAQ "Why are there no import filters for Quark, Indesign or other commercial DTP applications?"], scribus.net Due to licensing issues, the software package does not include support for the [[Pantone Matching System|Pantone color matching system (PMS)]], which is included in some commercial DTP applications. Although Scribus supports [[Unicode]] character encoding, it currently does not properly support [[complex text layout|complex script rendering]] and so cannot be used with Unicode text for languages written with [[Arabic language#writing_system|Arabic]], [[Hebrew language#Writing_system|Hebrew]], [[Indic scripts|Indic]] and [[Southeast Asia|South East Asian]] [[writing system]]s.[http://bugs.scribus.net/view.php?id=3965 Scribus Metabug 3965: Support for non-latin languages ][http://bugs.scribus.net/view.php?id=1547 Scribus bug 1547: Support for Indic Scripts] ==Release History== [[Image:Scribus-win.PNG|right|thumb|Scribus 1.3.3.7 in Windows]] {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !
